title: Commending Dr. Allen C. Martin upon the occasion of his appointment as Pastor of Bethel Seventh Day Adventist Church
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION commending Dr. Allen C. Martin upon the occasion
of his appointment as Pastor of Bethel Seventh Day Adventist Church

WHEREAS, The character and richness of religious and community  life  in
this  noble Empire State is nourished and fulfilled through the faithful
concern and selfless devotion of those who would commit  their  energies
and purpose to the ministry of others; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to bring full recog-
nition  and just tribute to those individuals who distinguish themselves
and the ministry through their unremitting commitment and preeminence of
service; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to commend Dr. Allen C.
Martin upon the occasion of his appointment as Pastor of Bethel  Seventh
Day Adventist Church; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  Allen C. Martin was born in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands,
USA; he was raised in New York City and accepted the Advent message as a
teenager; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Allen C. Martin attended  Oakwood  University  in  Hunts-
ville,  Alabama,  and received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Theology and
Biblical Languages; his graduate work started at Andrews  University  in
Berrien  Springs,  Michigan,  where  he  received  a  Master of Divinity
degree; he has completed postgraduate studies at the renowned Post-Grad-
uate Center of Mental Health in psychology and counseling  in  New  York
City;  he is a graduate of the distinguished Hebrew Union College Insti-
tute of Jewish Religion with a doctorate in Pastoral Counseling; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Dr. Allen C. Martin has done further studies  at
Rutgers University, in New Jersey, in the field of substance abuse coun-
seling;  he  is also the first Seventh Day Adventist clergy person to be
certified by the New York State Council of Churches as a Prison Chaplain
and is presently in the process of receiving certification as  a  mental
health facilities chaplain; he has also completed the required hours for
certification  to  be  a  substance abuse counselor for the State of New
York; and
  WHEREAS, Pastor Martin has pastored 14 churches  in  the  Northeastern
Conference  and served as the Assistant to the President of Northeastern
Conference in Western New York;  he  has  conducted  several  successful
evangelistic  crusades, Revelation Seminars and Youth Counseling Forums;
he has conducted seminars on Rite of Passage Programs and Ministering to
At-Risk Youth for the Youth Department of  the  General  Conference;  he
plans  to  complete  another  graduate academic program in the fields of
mental health counseling and marriage and family therapy; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Allen C. Martin has been actively  engaged  in  community
work throughout the course of his ministry; he served as a counselor and
Red  Cross chaplain at Ground Zero after the World Trade Center tragedy;
he was instrumental in  bringing  therapeutic  relief  to  grieving  and
suffering families due to this historic unfortunate occurrence; in addi-
tion to his pastoral duties, he served as an intervention specialist for
the  New  York  public  school system; for three years he also counseled
at-risk youth including gang members and dysfunctional teenagers;  as  a
result  of his work, a number of these troubled youth are now productive
and successful adults; and
  WHEREAS, An exemplary leader, Dr. Allen C. Martin operated  the  first
city-funded  senior  citizen program among Seventh Day Adventists at the
Flatbush Seventh Day  Adventist  Church  while  serving  as  pastor;  he
actively supports the elected officials in his district and has plans to
further  his  community  involvement; he is particularly concerned about
the high incarceration  and  unemployment  rate  among  African-American

young men in New York City; he is also concerned about economic empower-
ment for the people in the Brooklyn community; and
  WHEREAS,  In  recognition  of  his  efforts of in-depth magnitude, Dr.
Allen C. Martin received the Good News Maker Award and was distinguished
as a 21st Century Trailblazing Religious Leader by the  CHRISTIAN  TIMES
newspaper;  furthermore, he is a member of the advisory United Community
Development Committee and is currently serving as the President  of  the
Ministerial  Association  of  the Northeastern Conference of Seventh Day
Adventists; and
  WHEREAS, With him throughout has been his wife, Dana, who feels privi-
leged to be a part of his life and rejoices in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Allen C. Martin has brought to his ministry an overwhelm-
ing spirit of charity and compassion, acting from  vision  and  enlight-
enment  in  conducting  his  administrative  and spiritual duties, while
always displaying the highest standards  of  personal  and  professional
integrity and dedication; and
  WHEREAS, This distinguished man of God has always given enlightenment,
guidance  and  wisdom to the many entrusted to his care and has adminis-
tered abundantly and unstintingly to the spiritual and corporal needs of
all; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when  a  person
of such noble aims and accomplishments is brought to our attention it is
appropriate  to  publicly and jubilantly proclaim and commend that indi-
vidual for the edification of others; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  Dr.  Allen  C.  Martin  upon the occasion of his appointment as
Pastor of Bethel Seventh Day Adventist Church,  noting  his  unremitting
and  compassionate  faith  and his exemplary service to God, man and his
community, and extending to him the heartfelt best wishes of this Legis-
lative Body for a future of purposeful success and well-being; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Dr. Allen C. Martin.
